div.ab: Grate brazilwood very finely, put it to soak one or two hours in clear water, then take this tinted water & add to it some clear water & you will make e wine as clear as you like. If you please, put a drop of lemon or orange juice in it & it will immediately turn white. It can be drunk without danger.
It is said that pulverised talc blown into a lamp renders them thus.

For shooting your arquebus precisely, it is necessary that the end of the breech be & come precisely on the edge of the touch-hole, because in this manner the powder catches & burns all at once without blowing & has more force & does not push back. On the contrary, if the breech is made hollow, as they commonly are, the powder catches sooner in this place, makes it push back, & blows, which a chambered arquebusc_043v_01 clearly shows, because it pushes back more than another. And since the barrel is bigger at the breech than at the muzzle the sights are also uneven, for that at the breech is higher than that at the muzzle. And then, the thickness of the barrel gains about one line over the calibre, and the sight another line. It would therefore be necessary to either make the barrel all of one size or to raise the stock at the end & towards the muzzle, & sink it in & lower it towards the breechc_043v_02. The weight of the powder must be the third part of the ball.

div.head: Hail-shot of the arquebus
div.ab: If you want it to go together, set a piece of felt or leather or paper on top, according to the distance, & let the piece be made with a form precisely cut according to the caliber of the arquebusc_043v_03.
